title: Worker stole more than £40,000 from firms to buy holidays and ‘luxury items'
text:
Worker stole more than £40,000 from firms to buy holidays and ‘luxury items' Emily Watson, 25, admitted three counts of theft at Manchester magistrates court Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
A worker has admitted stealing thousands of pounds from three companies to buy holidays and ‘luxury items’. 
Emily Watson, 25, appeared at Manchester magistrates’ court and pleaded guilty to three counts of theft. 
She admitted stealing £29,016 belonging to Secure Property Investments, based in Sale . 
Watson also pleaded guilty to stealing £14,034 from Ascend Properties, based in Deansgate, and £1,416 from Manchester-based Expedite. 
The court was told that Watson was a ‘trusted employee’ and that she had access to company credit cards. Read More Man hid body of dead girlfriend in airing cupboard for 15 months 
She used the cards to buy holidays and ‘luxury items’ including clothes, magistrates were told. 
The court heard Watson pleaded guilty to three counts of theft but that she may dispute the amount stolen when she next appears at crown court. 
Watson, of Allen Road, Urmston , was granted conditional bail. 
Magistrates sent the case to Manchester’s Minshull Street Crown Court, where she will be sentenced on March 16. Like us on Facebook
